website_summaries.verdict: The meatiest urinary system supplement available, these small, chewy, and tasty treats help to maintain the health of your cat’s bladder, immune system, and respiratory system.
pros: Delicious supplement treats include real chicken, fish, and cheese
Cranberry fiber supports urinary system health
Your cat will come running to consume her daily supplement
cons: This otherwise healthy supplement does include wheat flour, which cats on grain-free diets should avoid

customer_reviews.title: ROCK HARD
customer_reviews.text: Only buy these if you're interested in breaking your cat's teeth on these inexplicably hard rocks. They look as though they'd be soft, and therefore easy to chew, but they are harder than even normal crunchy cat food or treats! My cat used to love these because they were soft and manageable, but it's really unfortunate that something has changed and now he can no longer chew them at all. Having a powder and gel formula doesn't help because he doesn't like those types at all (tried both of those versions) so until this problem is fixed, they are not something I'd buy again because they are no where near edible in their current rock hard state :(
customer_reviews.author: Helen P

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these treats!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats who have needed to be on lysine supplements since they were kittens to ward off respiratory/eye infections. We tried a different brand of lysine treats that were lighter color and larger (fish-shaped about the size of a dime). One cat would eat them if only if I cut them into smaller pieces; the other wouldn't eat them at all. But they LOVE these treats! These are about 1/4 the size of the other treats, and they love the taste. I put them in their treat puzzles and they go wild! I alternate between using these treats and a lysine gel for daily maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Wasn'tME

customer_reviews.title: Cats don't like them.
customer_reviews.text: OK. L-Lyseine works very well for cats with Feline Herpes Virus (FHV.) 500-1000mg a day will keep their sneezes and runny eyes in check, the same way it will with your cold sore. But you have to get it into them! My cats did not like these chews. So they did not work. What DOES work is Duralactin Feline L-Lyseine Paste. I just squirt it in their mouth and their lives become SO MUCH nicer!
customer_reviews.author: J. GrayTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: It really helped !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Besides Sierra living the taste it really stopped all her sneezing. When I first adopted her that's all she kept doing. Congested and sneezing all thevtime. I am on my second package and she sneezes no more. I first started out giving the package amounts to her. I now slowly took her off them for awhile. I had first bought this from the vet in tune liquid form it was messy a nd she wanted nothing to do with it. Went in Amazon and seen they had it in food form. Best thing I ever did. Sierra is now a very happy and playful cat.
customer_reviews.author: K. Krugler

customer_reviews.title: Revitalize Your Cat!
customer_reviews.text: I don't review unless I love or hate the product. I love this product! We have a 17 year old cat that we could get to eat. She isn't sick; just old. A family member said this revived his old cat. We bought them and chopped them up to put on our cats food. She loves them and is eating well again. Her energy is higher than it's been in a few years. She is always hungry now and without these she would have wasted away. I don't give her the daily recommendation as she is a very small cat 5lbs. Perhaps she gets 6-8 a day. Hope this helps your cat too!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for Product Consistency
customer_reviews.text: The product has been inconsistent. The pas few orders, the pellets were different sizes and dry. Cats wouldn't eat them. Now, the product has an entirely different color, texture. Cats seem to do ok. The previous product that we had used for a long time worked very well. I hope the company has worked out the kinks and we can count on consistency.
customer_reviews.author: mchiara

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates these now :(
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to love these but now refuses to eat them. Did the formula change?
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Too tough / hard for my cat to chew
customer_reviews.text: These are too tough / hard for my cat to chew. She tries to eat them, rolls them around in her mouth and then spits them back out, even though they are supposed to be 'chews'. She has no problems with her teeth, and no problems mowing through crunchy food and treats. I tried smashing a couple with my fingers, and that didn't work either. I tried cutting a couple in half, that didn't work either, as she just ate the other treats around them and left them behind. These will end up in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Split decision from my cats
customer_reviews.text: My vet gave me our first bag of Enisyl treat when one of my four cats had a virus. All four were supposed to eat the treats to try to keep the virus from spreading. I've had good new/bad news luck with them. The cat that had the virus loves these treats and continues to get them every day. They have worked great for her. The other three tried them once and are not interested in eating them, and as most cat owners know, you don't get a cat to eat what the cat doesn't want. But I will continue to give them to the one cat who is more prone to illness. She loves them, and they love her.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Abbett

customer_reviews.title: Great for health
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who gets cold easily. My vet suggested these when he was a kitten. I give him a few each day as a preventative. When he goes off them, he starts sneezing and when I put him back on them, the cold with the nose sneezing and runny eyes stops. Also, they are less expensive to get on Amazon than the vet's office.
customer_reviews.author: penny bowers

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Originally recommended by our vet. Adopted our cat from local humane society. He has recurring respiratory issues. These are easy for him to chew, and he loves them.. This particular shipper has been AWESOME!!! At a time when everyone seems to be stressed, it's nice that we can depend on receiving these so quickly, and maintain our care for our 4 legged family member.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vtoquinol Enisyl-F Lysine Treats 6.35 oz.
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a bad reaction from a steroid shot he was given and was very sick as it activated a dormant virus. When he got well the Vet suggested this product for helping his immune system to keep him from having this happen again. At first I had trouble with him eating them I had to be sneaky to get him to eat them. Then when I ordered again from this supplier all of a sudden there was no problem, he looks forward to them every morning. My cat loves it and have no problems giving him this once daily. He has been on it for almost 1 year now and I am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral cat with a susceptibility to eye-winking (probably feline herpes). I give him six of these per day and they keep his eyes from becoming puffy and inflamed. They're a good small size and seemingly easy to chew, unlike other lysine treats. These treats are small/round and I can fling them far into the yard and he chases them! They're so small that sometimes he smacks them downward causing them lodge into his paw and he sits there chewing on his paw trying to get the treat out.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: my treat loving cat won't touch them
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who loves treats... she loves all kinds of weird things... pepperjack cheese, bananas, sweet potato fries... and just about every brand of cat food and treat on the market... she eats wet food with the powder mixed in... but not these expensive treats... plus you are supposed to give them 12 treats twice a day... much more expensive than the powder and apparently even less appealing. save yourself the hassle, and get the powder.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen Stengel

customer_reviews.title: Not Economical- Cat doesn't like
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely refuses to eat these, and he loves treats. These are also not economical. You have to give way too many on a daily basis...... If you can get them to eat it. I will stick to their powder form. Easily disguised in wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Deni h

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my older cat (rescue) who has a lot of issues. I thought I could break these up and put them in his wet food; however, these are so hard I wasn't able to. Didn't matter anyways as he smelled them and walked away. I found another product that was more palatable and he ate them like they were treats.
customer_reviews.author: moonsbreath

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Great size for my cat and apparently they taste great (haven't tried them myself!), because she specifically asks for them. We mix a few in with her regular dry food and add a bit of water and swirl to make a gravy. We got them because of the scientific trials that say they can help with upper respiratory viruses for cats (antibiotics haven't helped), and she has been coughing less. I'm hoping this will help clear it up completely. We'll see!
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than the gel form.
customer_reviews.text: My cats often get upper respiratory issues so I sometimes give them Lysine gel in their food. They seem to like it, but share a food dish and it is difficult to determine the amount each cat consumes. These "treats" are much easier to administer and don't have a yucky smell. The only negative I encountered is that one of my cats does not care for the flavor and won't eat more than one. I may try another flavor next time I order.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Putin

customer_reviews.title: Too hard!
customer_reviews.text: Too hard for my cat to chew. Lacy is 3 years old, not too young or too old to chew hard stuff, but this supplement is way too hard and big for cat’s mouth. My cat seems ok with the flavor since she ate when I gave her with my hand. But it took forever for her to chew it. She dropped it several times to eat 1 piece. And when I put in her bowl, she never ate it. Tried to avoid it and ate only her normal foods which were mixed with this supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: I adopted a cat from the clinic from a bad situation and he has the symptoms of feline herpes
customer_reviews.text: I work at a Veterinary Clinic and we prescribe these treats to cats who have feline herpes. I adopted a cat from the clinic from a bad situation and he has the symptoms of feline herpes. Eye and nose discharge, sneezing, ect. I got these online because they're cheaper than where we get them from. Overall, I haven't noticed a change in discharge/sneezing. He's his normal, active little self. He doesn't seem to love the treats, so I mix them in a small bowl with some of his favorite treats and he gobbles them right up. I will keep giving Lysine treats as they are so good for him, but I will be exploring other brand options.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We had to give one of our cats Lysine. Well, trying to force a pill down his throat was impossible. Then the receptionist at the vet said you can buy them in treats, so naturally, as always, I looked on Amazon & lo and behold, I found several types, but these were highly rated. My cats LOVE them! This was my first order, so only ordered one bag, but I placed a second order for 3 bags and that should last quite some time. I am so thankful these are available!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl G.

customer_reviews.title: Finally one Mikey will eat.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many other types and brands. He hated the gel. I tried putting it on his paw and nose. He hated the powder ones . No matter how small the amount was he knew it was in his food.He would not eat any other treat ones. Now when he hears me with the bag , he comes running. I put it on the rug and he gobbles them up. Mikey has feline herpes and I hope this will help him. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: nancy tully

customer_reviews.title: Cat eats them!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just happy my cat is eating them with her food and the vet said it would help her. The one thing that does bug me is the bag recommends 12 pieces twice a day. You burn through a bag very quickly. Couldn't they put a higher dose per piece, maybe pets wouldn't eat them if they did? I don't know but I would like to not be buying so many bags. They could sell a bigger bag too.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes to eat this
customer_reviews.text: Any time I find something nutritious that my cat will eat, I'm happy! My cat takes this as a supplement (got okay from her vet), and I give it to her as a treat. To be fair, I also alternate this w/ two other brands of lysine chews, so maybe switching chews around helps. As for its efficacy, it's hard to measure.
customer_reviews.author: Sharpshopper

customer_reviews.title: Makes my cat stop sneezing
customer_reviews.text: When I mentioned that my cat sneezes 10-15 times in a row sometimes and occasionally gets gross eye gunk, my vet recommended these. I've noticed fewer cat sneezes overall and no more of the 10 sneezes in a row situation. The cat seems to like them about as much as he likes other treats so I imagine the taste is pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: Alli7530

customer_reviews.title: Big Dud
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian suggested this product to battle a virus that's causing my cat eye and nasal issues. He won't touch these treats. I've put them in his food bowl and he eats around them. I toss them to make a game out of it and he chases them, then immediately turns away. Probably should have guessed that they don't taste good since they're described on the bag as being "palatable". Not delicious, yummy, etc. Palatable. I wasted my money, but will try for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: After a couple of week this really did help!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The treats are very easy to get your fur baby to eat, after about a two week period my cats wheezing went down a considerable amount even by using 2/3 the recommended amount. Cons: You do have to be diligent on giving the fur baby’s these treats. If you miss a day it might not get into their system well enough to work properly. Think of it like a supplement you have to be on your game or else what’s the point in using them.
customer_reviews.author: Top reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very hard compared to the same product purchased from the vet’s office.
customer_reviews.text: These bite size pieces were significantly darker and harder than the product we purchase directly from our vet. Our poor senior kitties can’t chew the treats I purchased on Amazon. We have lost trust purchasing this item on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: True Love

customer_reviews.title: Good value, priced right
customer_reviews.text: I got these treats for my cat to build his immune system up because he has herpes viral of the eyes. When he gets stressed, he gets a flare up with his eyes along with congestion. these were recommend by my vet and I switch back and forth between this product and the paste.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Keating

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates the new formula
customer_reviews.text: My cat gets constant upper respiratory infections and needed these to help boost his immune system. I used to buy them from the vet and they were crunchy and then I found them on Anazon cheaper so I bought them here. When I got them they were different...smaller snd soft treats. My cat is super picky and will not touch any soft treats...so he won't eat them. I thought it was just a mistake buying from Amazon so I reordered from my vet..and the new bag I got from them was also the newer soft version. He used to love them but now hates them so I had to order the powder to sprinkle on their food.
customer_reviews.author: azgrl

customer_reviews.title: Qulaity issue.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product for over a year and usually my four cats all love it, but my last order was terrible. I had ordered four bags, but in every bag, the "treats" were dry, squashed and clumped together. They were not nearly the quality of other packages I have received. Only two cats would eat them at all, but very unenthusiastically and very reluctantly. The other two cats would not touch them. I was very disappointed with what I received. I have ordered the product again (only one package this time) as they have been recommended by my veterinarian, but I'm not sure what I will do if the poor quality continues.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Mum

customer_reviews.title: Gooey and messy and my cats said Yuk!
customer_reviews.text: These were gooey and my cats were not happy about eating them, rejecting them at first, while normally, they enjoy them. I think the formulation must have changed. I have purchased numerous times from various vendors, without problems.
customer_reviews.author: StarryStarryNight

customer_reviews.title: Great for pets with allergies
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my cats, so I can't actually attest to the flavor! But they love it and come running when they hear the package crinkle. It is the same brand that my veterinarian carries, but it costs a bit less. and I can get it anytime I want from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MBE

customer_reviews.title: Kitty gobbles them up!  Shhhhh.  Don't tell him its medication.
customer_reviews.text: These were prescribed by our Vet, by name, after my cat suffered an eye infection. I ordered the wrong Lysine by accident and found that my cat wouldn't touch the replacement. He loves these treats, and gobbles them up with no coaxing. Tip: Be careful with the zip top closure. If it isn't closed correctly or if it is torn loose the bits will dry out and apparently they become unpalatable to my little Prince of Mischief ( I've learned the hard way). If the top loses integrity, simply store them in an airtight container and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product for my cat's eyes that were tearing up often. Worked great and started showing improvement rapidly. Flavor worked, she was a bit hesitant at first but she did eat them at her own volition which was great. Value is so so due to the amount required to serve, but on the other hand it worked for me, I have a healthy cat and I would consider this item if I need it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective for our cats and they do enjoy eating these
customer_reviews.text: These lysine treats were recently recommended by our vet for our adult housecat. The vet kindly recommended that we check prices elsewhere (vs purchasing from their office), and sure enough the cost here on Amazon was about half what they would have charged. I can't comment to what others are saying about the formulation of this product having changed, but I can say that our cats both eat these eagerly. We give them six per day which is the recommended dosage. These treats also do seem to be effective in treating our cats symptoms.
customer_reviews.author: Phil in Magnolia

customer_reviews.title: Great pil for cats with some eye problems
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this pill to me for our cat. He kept getting eye infections almost every 6 months or less. I give him 6 pills in the mining and 6 in the evening and that seems to have done the trick !This is the best pill for cats to control eye infections from reoccurring. Product was delivered on time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great, now quality is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for years. Last two packages are hard as rocks. My poor cat can't eat them. Tried everything to make them softer but nothing works. So disappointed. Won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Good treats, my cats enjoy them
customer_reviews.text: This works well for two of my cats but makes my third cat sick within a day or two of eating these treat. He ends up with horrible allergy symptoms like water eyes, runny nose, etc. I've started and stopped them with him enough times to KNOW it's the treats, and my vet concurs. It's not the treats, it's the way my cat's immune system processes the lysine -- they trigger an immune response in him. I thought it worth mentioning in case other cat owners have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Juusan

customer_reviews.title: Not so good for cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats hate these. They had trouble chewing them and eventually gave up. Now when I try to give these to my cats they act like I’m punishing them.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: No love for this version
customer_reviews.text: Not so much that I don't like it, but my cats don't! They gobbled up the previous version but since the taste (evidently) and texture was changed my cats turn up their noses and walk away. So now I order the VetriScience brand and they love those.
customer_reviews.author: Artzy

customer_reviews.title: My cat with feline herpes has been eating these treats ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat with feline herpes has been eating these treats for years to control his flareups. Now that they have changed the formula, he won't touch them so I returned these. I just saw my vet yesterday and he sold me a bag of Vetri-Lysine Plus, 120 Bite-Sized Chews for $36 so I won't be buying them from him any more. I've found them on here for $15 a bag. My cat loves them! And the amount you give them each day is 2 vs. 6 of this Vetoquinol brand so you save even more $$.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a lot better, product changed.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for years with great success, and my cat gobbled them up. Began using them on the advice of my veterinarian. The last batch I ordered this summer my cat will not touch. The product is much less soft than it has been, and she will not eat them. She needs them for her health, so am open to other suggestions, brands. Used this for YEARS! Don't know what happened that now the consistency is so much harder than before. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats
customer_reviews.text: All of my cats are rescues and all of them had a virus when I purchased them. 3 times a year I purchase these and give them to the cats as directed. If I didnt my cats would all get the runny eyes and sneezing. It's great stuff - expensive, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Finally a "treat" my picky feline will eat!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat with constant viral eye "infections" will eat these, but not when they are "fresh": I have to let them dry out some...I guess he doesn't like the smell at first. Cats are so weird. I had tried two other kinds and he wouldn't touch them. I had previously been mixing powdered L-Lysine powder in with canned food twice a day, but that is a pain. This is much simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reduces symptoms of feline herpes
customer_reviews.text: My rescue cat a 10 lb short hair torti needs this for her feline herpes as she manifests symptoms of sneezing and watery eyes. These pieces reduce her symptoms, we are thsnkful to have found these.
customer_reviews.author: OFB

customer_reviews.title: Works for My Cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat has feline herpes. When it flares up, she gets snotty and sneezy. My vet recommended these and they do help. My cat loves them and thinks they are just treats. They are expensive, but they do help.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn

customer_reviews.title: I thought she might like having the treats
customer_reviews.text: Nothing against the supplement itself, my cat has been taking the gel version mixed with food and it has a positive effect on her health. I thought she might like having the treats, but she won't eat them. I resorted to grinding them up in a food processor and adding the bits to her food in small amounts so I didn't waste my money on this (which is working). So treats a complete fail, but the supplement itself is good, I'll just have to go back to the gel version.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent products! Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These are very effective in keeping my cat's healthy. The lysine is very effective in things like eye irritations that occasionally pop up. The kitties are very finicky eating and choosy but they just love these treats. They also like chasing them across the floor if you throw them!
customer_reviews.author: NYC Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than the paste
customer_reviews.text: I like these treats more than the paste, but it's kind of annoying to feed 6-12 treats at a time. I have two cats and only one of them gets these, so it's hard to keep the second one away while the first one gets his medicine treats. I prefer the larger treats, and he doesn't seem to mind gnawing on them.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Treats eagerly consumed
customer_reviews.text: Considering that these treats has ingredients that I wouldn't eat... (sugar, corn & potassium sorbate), the cats just love these treats. It has only been about 3 weeks., and I notice that the eye problem has cleared up. One cat had a runny eye, from the time we got her @ the shelter. Her eye has cleared, some. The other cat (a throw away... owner didn't want him anymore) had chronic "sleepers" every a.m. These have cleared up, almost completely. And, they have been on these supplements less than a month. Over all, a good purchase. I will buy these, again, as long as they don't get TOOOOO expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Melodee A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: My cat was having some sneezes, watery eyes. I’ve used the powder for cats in the past figured I’d try these. I think for one cat it’s worth it. The portion size is large so I think it I had multiple cats I would use the powder. But my cat loves the taste of the treats would eat all of them if he could!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasty and effective
customer_reviews.text: My cat is allergic to plastic, and if he rubs his face on anything plastic his skin breaks out very badly. We minimize exposure as much as possible, but it's very difficult to do in a house. He loves the taste of these, and they work incredibly well to prevent allergic breakouts and also reverse them if his skin is in bad shape. I swear by these!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Leis

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these and views them entirely as treats instead of nutrition. Just be sure to keep the bag sealed or they dry out and then my cat didn't like them as much. My only criticism is that the Ziploc part of the bag is not constructed well and falls apart with repeated opening and closing, forcing me to eventually result to a paper clip.
customer_reviews.author: Devin L. Cutler

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Really works! Vet gave me the gel and cats would not eat it and these two of my cats, the ones that reallly need them, eat them every morning for a treat and it contains their sleep in their eyes and sneezing. Highly recommended ! No RX needed and cheaper than the gel.
customer_reviews.author: Leeannie

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these. It asked for a flavor rating, sorry but I'm not trying them out for flavor but I'm sure he would agree they are flavor full!!! Average price but delivered to my door for convenience of not going to the vet to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Lysine Cat Treats
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted an 8 year old female cat from the Humane Society. The veterinarian who examined her a few days later determined that she had a bit of an upper respiratory disturbance going on; she was coughing and sneezing. He recommended the Lysine cat treats to help cure her respiratory condition. I found this seller had the very best price on Lysine - half of what my veterinarian's office charges, and I ordered a bag. Shipping was speedy and the packaging was adequate for the treats to arrive intact. My cat absolutely loves them - she begs for them and within a few days, her coughing and sneezing had stopped completely. I would highly recommend this supplement for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Tacomapat

customer_reviews.title: Cats love these liver flavored bits
customer_reviews.text: As a supplement goes the cats eat them easily and I've bought more than once. I haven't noticed any negative effects on cats either, no puking them up or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth S.

customer_reviews.title: Perf Cure for Bouts of Feline Resp virus
customer_reviews.text: I adopted my kitty as she was recovering from a respiratory infection / meaning that she has the virus dormant forever. I haven't had a cat with that, so 6 mos later I was plagued when she seemed to get a super bad cold! So sad .. took her to vet and they gave her this (which I buy and give her regularly now) and she was literally cured within 48 hours with the extra dosing! Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Daly

customer_reviews.title: Great item, my cat loves these.
customer_reviews.text: Read a few reviews about these being crunchy treats and how the newer ones they were shipping were soft treats. Just got these and they are the soft treats. My cat loves them. He recently got an upper respiratory (never around other cats, lives inside, no exposure), the vet thinks because he had a URI as a kitten in a shelter that it may pop up throughout his life. Got these to give him, hoping they may prevent future URI's. We'll see how that goes. Either way, he loves them. I just do the suggested maintenance dose (six per day), no issues at all. Will add a photo of what they look like as well.
customer_reviews.author: H.G.

customer_reviews.title: shocked!
customer_reviews.text: I have two very picky cats and they both love these. I have a cat that has Feline Herpes and Lysine was recommended by my Vet. I have tried many treats and they usually walk away from them. Both my cats love these!!
customer_reviews.author: LisaMaria72

customer_reviews.title: The old one in the foil pouch my cat LOVED. I ordered 4 pouches of what was picture ...
customer_reviews.text: They definitely changed this product. The old one in the foil pouch my cat LOVED. I ordered 4 pouches of what was picture to be the old foil pouch and was shipped this version instead. It's harder and my cat won't touch it. I'm returning them and am contacting my vet to see what my alternatives are. It's a shame because the old version helped a lot. Has anyone found a suitable and palatable replacement?
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Kitty approved
customer_reviews.text: My cats loves these treats. They are the perfect size for them to eat. Yes, it's a bit of a pain to have to count out 6 or 12 treat; however, the ones that only call for one treat are actually too big for my cats and I end up breaking them apart for them. Additionally, these treats are the only ones my black cat will eat (my other cat will pretty much eat anything). My vet recommended these treats to treat my cat's runny eye. It has worked great keeping his eye healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Their paste is better
customer_reviews.text: Did they change something since 5 or 8years ago? Now they are harder and/or awkward shape.. cat spits them out. Even when swallowed.. not effective like it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: DaylightMoon

customer_reviews.title: Kitty is sneezing no more!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got my cat from the rescue league, I noticed she was sneezing a LOT. I brought her to the vet and they suggested that I start her on these treats (plus an antibiotic, she was so sick). They suggested that I maintain her health with these treats, and she's been eating them daily for the past 4 years. It definitely helps cut down on the sneezing. When I sense that she is sneezing more than normal, I up the amount I give her per day and it helps. My vet sells these treats, but it's far more economical to buy them on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: K10ma

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended L-Lysine to help my cats immune systems. One of them has asthma and is at risk for respiratory illnesses. The cats have been on these supplements for several years and they consider them treats. I don't know for sure that these are the reason for no respiratory issues since they started taking them but I figure they can't hurt!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these, it helps with motivation for ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these, it helps with motivation for his pill he has to take also which is so helpful. The only issue I constantly have is the seal rips off of the bag where it attaches. So I alway have to put them into a new container before the bag is gone to keep them fresh. So product I rate 5/5 and packaging I’d rate 1.5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Wenger

customer_reviews.title: They changed the formula, and neither cats will eat them now :(
customer_reviews.text: They changed the formula, and neither cats will eat them now :( I need them to have them since they are for feline herpes which makes the change frustrating. I hope they notice all of the bad taste reviews and change the formula!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Walker

customer_reviews.title: Picture of full bag is NOT what I received!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously?? This bag isn’t even half full. I paid WAY too much money and there is hardly anything in the bag. Same price at the vet for 4x as much!!!!! The picture shows a FULL bag- very misleading!! Will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Video Fan

customer_reviews.title: Formula change
customer_reviews.text: I bought these years ago for my cat who was put on a special diet due to crystals in their urine. The cats are them up! Since that time, the formula/taste has changed. The once popular treat is now avoided by my cats. For the price, it’s not worth taking a chance on them. If your cat liked the older version, they likely won’t eat the new one. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: yep, these are the cat treats
customer_reviews.text: I looked for these, found them, and had them delivered. They are expensive but the vet says to give them to the cat every day. The ones that arrived are indeed the same kind we had before and we are now feeding them to the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved them. Ate them up like l gave her candy. LoL My vet tech sold me the pump gel. She loved them both. And it is so healthy for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Skyangelmd

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these treats.
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my two older cats these treats for about four months now for mild herpes infections, and I've seen a definite improvement in their health. The cats have gone from 8-10 wet sneezes a day to only 1-2 light sneezes, which makes it much more pleasant to have them on my lap most of the time. My vet had recommended these cat treats to me and I'd bought my first bag from her for $25. Yikes! So I turned to Amazon to see if I could find a better price and, of course, Amazon had them for around $16 - 17 a bag, w/free shipping. Much better! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: appletree83

customer_reviews.title: One cat will eat them!
customer_reviews.text: One cat is ok with the flavor of them, the other cat has to have them cut up into smaller chunks before eating. The are a little hard - not chewy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Nauman

customer_reviews.title: disliked
customer_reviews.text: My cat would not touch the bites. It was a waste of money. Wish I had been able to get a sample pack first for a small price to try it with her first.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Moses

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cat's herpes symptoms at bay.
customer_reviews.text: We adopted 2 cats from a shelter 3 years ago. Both came with a few health issues & we eventually discovered after multiple vet visits that our little girl cat, Arwen has feline herpes, which meant she was having almost constant eye infections. She has been on Enisyl-F for about 2 years now & her eyes are much cleaner. She loves the treats so they must taste good too! My only gripe is on the maximum dose of 12 treats per day, this does become quite pricy - it used to be available for $11 a packet, but I can't seem to find it for less than $16 now.
customer_reviews.author: Karen LR

customer_reviews.title: I moved to these treats from another provider. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I moved to these treats from another provider. The other provider supplied larger and drier/harder treats that didn't get received by my cat beyond day two. My pet did use these for most of a week, but I reverted to the paste supplement. But if you need to supply Lysine and your pet isn't a bit of a diva, you will be able to get by with these. Properly sized for the average short hair and moist enough to be consumed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rojek

customer_reviews.title: Okay product
customer_reviews.text: These work fine if you have a cat that will eat treats. But if you have a cat that is a picky eater you might have trouble with these and find the paste works better. I have two cats, the one who had the virus when we adopted him (and we didn't know he had it) and our other cat who got the virus from him. One is a very picky eater, so the paste is better for him. But for the cost is seems like the treats go a bit longer per dose than the paste. This virus is a pain to deal with, but these products really help keep it in control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddiction

customer_reviews.title: Changed the formula, hard as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: They went from soft powdery pellets my cat loved to dense rocks she can't even chew. They were amazingly hard to even dissolve or break down so that my cats could eat them. Such a strange texture. I switched to just buying lysine pills, crushing them up and mixing them with my cat's wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Doe

customer_reviews.title: No problem with shipper; what's up with manufacturer?
customer_reviews.text: Normally, this is like "kitty crack". My cat begs for it. I have to keep it on hand for a health condition and I use it to reward my cat for good behavior. Didn't think I'd have to worry about quality being consistent: this lot was another color, didn't smell the same, & Lily turned up her nose at it. Do I have to worry about what's in the package, especially since it's not cheap?
customer_reviews.author: Jassyjo

customer_reviews.title: My cats actually like these
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I tried these, and the cat with the respiratory and eye issues wouldn't touch them (but of course the other two who have no such issues loved them). I tried them again recently and now she is crazy about them. I'm not sure if the formula changed or if she just decided to like them, but either way this is so much easier than giving her the gel so I'm thrilled. I wish they were less expensive so I could just give them to all 3 cats, but I just give them regular treats at the same time I give these to the cat who needs them.
customer_reviews.author: nerdgirl78664

customer_reviews.title: Cat won’t eat them
customer_reviews.text: They may be great, but my cat won’t eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this medication
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this medication but the packaging doesn't close and then the bits get dry and she no longer wants them. Its expensive too! So I hope they fix the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Great treat and value
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves them! I thought that would be an issue. But cant stop him! Its helping him to with his upper respiratory infection.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mengucci

customer_reviews.title: keeps herpes symptoms away.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it just fine, but she just loves treats and food in general because she's fat, so don't take my word for it on flavor. I read some other reviews where their cat didn't like the taste. My cat is not picky. It works just fine in keeping her herpes symptoms down. Her eyes tend to wink, so I always give her a combination daily of eye drops and these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Volt

customer_reviews.title: Yeast-free treats
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with lost of allergies, including yeast (though Brewer's yeast wasn't on the panel, he was allergic to 6-8 other types of yeast), so I was looking for some lysine snack/treat didn't contain yeast. My cats eat only wet food, so they won't eat these by themselves the way they would VetriLysine treats, but there aren't any issues it I sprinkle the pellets on their dinner. I am very glad to have found lysine that wasn't a gel (not pet-sitter friendly) or powder (my cats HATE it). I think this is a more expensive option than most treats, but the ingredients are decent enough, so I'm OK with it, since there aren't other options without yeast.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: New formula?  Not soft anymore....
customer_reviews.text: This bag arrived promptly with an expiration date of 2/2019. However, the old ones were soft. This bag looks hard and crumbly. Upon reading reviews, this appears to be due to manufacturer's new formula and no fault of the vendor. I will probably keep this bag, but I need to find softer chews.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferAnne

customer_reviews.title: Needed for healthy cat. Vet suggested item.
customer_reviews.text: My cat apparently got around at the local SPCA. I guess shelter cat often need this.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep your cats healthy and they like the taste, too
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this for our cats with allergies. At one time, they were herpes suspect, but that's since been ruled out and we've discovered they have a nasty grain allergy. Lysine helps with general health -- and we dose once a week just to keep them going. The great thing about this product is the taste. All four of our cats like these treats and will readily eat them. Actually the problem is, they will also readily eat the lysine of the other cats if they finish first! Rebecca Kyle, March 2014
customer_reviews.author: R. Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Different but the same?
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for over a year to treat a chronic problem with our cat. She loved them and it seemed to help. Latest batch I bought was a different color (much lighter in color) and our cat will not eat them where before she would eat them in preference to her food. No indication on packaging that there are different flavors. Packaging is the same for old and new product...
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Vetoquinol Treats are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: My cat has continuous runny eyes due to an infection as a baby. The vet. suggested lifelong lysine. I was using the gel and having to fight him over giving it to him. I discovered the Vetoquinol Treats and he loves them. He rarely has any eye discharge and the other cats try to get his treats away from him, so he gobbles them down. I have tried the other treats that were "chews" and were larger so only one was required. NOBODY liked them! I am sticking with these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen R.

customer_reviews.title: My cat hates them
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my cat won’t eat them. He turned his nose up at them immediately. He is a treat eater, too so I was surprised. $23 down the drain after my vet recommended them.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Clark

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The treats hardened - became too chewy like stale, chewy, rip your fillings out candy - after opening, within two days. My furry baby they were purchased specifically for would no longer eat them. One of my furry babies struggled to eat them but really likes the flavor. My other two wouldn't touch them. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enisyl-f lysine treats (Vitamins)
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for 2yrs for one of my cats with allergies. It has been wonderful until this last shipment. The nuggets are 1/2 the size they were and apparently they taste & smell different because he will not eat them. He always came for them in the morning while the other two cats ate reg. treats. I wrote to Amazon (not their fault) because they don't manufacture them. I wrote to the maker and really did not get a promising answer. I only hope they will change back to the original formula or I cannot buy them again. Judy J.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: better than the gel form of lysine
customer_reviews.text: Our two cats were prescribed lysine to shore up their immune systems. The vet sold us the gel version and the kitties wouldn't go within a mile of it. Evidently it's GROSS but I can't speak from first-hand experience. We were scheduled to leave for vacation in a matter of days and were delighted to find lysine treats with mostly very good reviews. The cats loved them for several weeks and have now gone off them. I can still sneak it into their canned food, but they won't take the treats alone or in Greenies. Bottom line: they're a big improvement on the gel form but don't expect miracles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat's love the taste
customer_reviews.text: My cats went crazy over these. I figured it was going to be one of those things where they smell it and turn away. Total opposite they loved these.
customer_reviews.author: Matrixchic

customer_reviews.title: What's up with the price for this stuff?
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that this product definately seems to help relieve the symptoms of feline herpes virus, mostly sneezing attacks and runny nose. It would get 5 stars except that the price keeps jumping. It's almost doubled in the last year. Human grade L-Lyseine is not an expensive amino acid and I'm sure the rest of the ingredients are standard low grade animal fill garbage. The non Amazon Prime price is lower but when the freight is added, it's actually more expensive. Might be time to look at some other manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Semicolon

customer_reviews.title: Provides Great Health Benefits!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a Rhinovirus herpes eye infection he contracted during successful treatment for a cancerous tumor. He was on the Lysine treats for several months and the runny eye seemed to get better. I stopped the treats for awhile, but now the runny eye problem has come back. After a week of giving it to him again, his eye has improved. I just wish this stuff wasn't so expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Maitlin

customer_reviews.title: My cat hates these.
customer_reviews.text: My cat didn’t like them at all. Spending 25$ and then my cat literally not touching them it was a complete waste of money. I wished they would have had a smaller bag to sample for a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ahrem

customer_reviews.title: Great For Weepy Eyes
customer_reviews.text: Our rescue kittens both have weep eyes and these little treats help keep the weepiness at bay. We will be ordering these on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: SoCaIrish

product_meta.title: Vetoquinol Enisyl-F Lysine Bites: L-Lysine Chews for Cats & Kittens - Chicken Liver-Flavor, 6.4oz (180g) Reclosable Bag
feature_bullets: Daily L-Lysine supplement for cats helps support a strong immune system and eye & respiratory health
Helps manage common feline health issues: sneezing, runny nose, squinting and watery, inflamed eyes
Delivers veterinarian-recommended amount of Lysine: cats = 500mg 2x daily, kittens = 250mg 2x daily
Lysine bites for cats and kittens provides specially-formulated immune support for as long as needed
Cats love the highly-palatable chicken liver flavor chews; easy to dose and administer; portable

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
